message:
Merge pull request #9535 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 22:04 UTC
ai_summary: This commit updates several Microsoft Entra documentation files.  Specifically, it modifies the lifecycle workflow tasks documentation to include information about setting a delay for removing access package assignments.  It also updates the Privileged Identity Management (PIM) documentation, clarifying how to assign roles with administrative unit scope and provides a link to manage them and updates the date. Finally, it includes a modified image file related to risk-based policy impact workbooks.

[Entra PIM] Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "pim-how-to-add-role-to-user.md" document. The changes include updating the "ms.date" metadata and refining the instructions for assigning roles with administrative unit scope. The updated content clarifies the process of assigning custom roles within administrative units and provides links to relevant documentation.

author: rolyon
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "pim-how-to-add-role-to-user.md" file. The changes involve updating a sentence related to assigning custom roles with administrative unit scope. The edit replaces a link to "Add and remove administrative units" with a link to "Create or delete administrative units" suggesting a minor update to the documentation for clarity.

author: rolyon
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks, specifically the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The changes include clarifying the ability to customize the task's name, description, and the delay before assignment removal within the Microsoft Entra admin center.  Additionally, the documentation now specifies arguments for the task within the Microsoft Graph implementation, including a parameter to set the number of days until the access package assignments expire.

author: rolyon
message: Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "pim-how-to-add-role-to-user.md" document, updating the modification date. The changes involve clarifying how to assign custom roles with administrative unit scopes. The updated content advises users to first open the administrative unit before assigning the role and provides links to relevant documentation for creating and managing administrative units.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9533 from OWinfreyATL/owinfreyATL-AccessPackageAssignmentBehavior-PublicPreview

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks, specifically the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task.  The update includes changes to the task's description, mentioning the ability to customize the removal delay, and provides details on the parameters used for Microsoft Graph, including a new "daysUntilExpiration" argument.  Additionally, there is no change to the second file, which appears to be an image file.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks related to Microsoft Graph. Specifically, it adds documentation for a "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The update includes a description of the task's arguments, explaining the "daysUntilExpiration" parameter used to define how long assignments should last.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflows in Microsoft Entra ID. Specifically, it modifies the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task to include options for customizing the task name, description, and the delay before assignments are removed.  The update also includes changes to the associated image and provides details on how to configure these options within the Microsoft Entra admin center and through Microsoft Graph.

author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
ai_summary:
This commit updates multiple Microsoft Entra ID documentation files. Key changes include:
*   Introducing new documentation on Certificate Revocation List (CRL) for certificate-based authentication, including how it works and configuration guidance.
*   Updating existing articles to reference the new CRL documentation and to reflect recent changes.
*   Several updates to existing documentation related to PIM audit logs, app management policies, and Microsoft Entra Connect prerequisites.
*   Renaming of image files related to certificate-based authentication.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9329 from vimrang/CRLChanges

creating new CRL page
ai_summary: This commit introduces significant updates to the documentation related to certificate-based authentication (CBA) in Microsoft Entra ID.  Key changes include a dedicated document explaining Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs), updates to existing documents to reference the new CRL documentation, renaming image files for consistency, and removing and/or reformatting content related to CRLs from other documents. The changes emphasize security best practices, particularly regarding CRL validation and the revocation process.

author: vimrang
ai_summary: This commit modifies a documentation file related to certificate-based authentication in Microsoft Entra ID. The changes include a single addition and deletion, resulting in a change to the title of a section about CRL errors from "eeference" to "reference." This suggests a minor correction or refinement of the documentation.

message:
Merge pull request #9495 from barclayn/2025-august-pim-log-history

updating date
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for viewing audit history in Microsoft Entra Privileged Identity Management (PIM).  It adds two new image files related to the audit logs. The primary change modifies the "pim-how-to-use-audit-log.md" file, refining the instructions for accessing and filtering audit logs, clarifying the purpose of "Resource audit" and "My audit" views, and updating the screenshots used.  The changes include updates to the required permissions and the date of the document.

Update SQL Server version in prerequisites
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md" file, updating the document. The changes include an update to the `ms.date` to reflect a more recent date and adjustments to the SQL Server versions mentioned in the context of the prerequisites. Specifically, the updated document references SQL Server 2019 components instead of SQL Server 2022 components.
